name: cffile
description:
Manages interactions with server files.
 Different combinations cause different attributes to be
 required.

params.name: action
params.description: Type of file manipulation that the tag performs.

params.name: mode
params.description:
Applies only to UNIX and Linux. Permissions. Octal values
 of Unix chmod command. Assigned to owner, group, and
 other, respectively.

params.name: output
params.description: String to add to the file

params.name: addnewline
params.description: Yes: appends newline character to text written to file

params.name: attributes
params.description:
Applies to Windows. A comma-delimited list of attributes
 to set on the file.

 If omitted, the file's attributes are maintained.

params.name: charset
params.description:
The character encoding in which the file contents is
 encoded.

 For more information on character encodings, see:
 www.w3.org/International/O-charset.html.

params.name: destination
params.description:
Pathname of a directory or file on web server
 (during copy).

params.name: variable
params.description: Name of variable to contain contents of text file.

params.name: filefield
params.description:
Name of form field used to select the file.

 Do not use pound signs (#) to specify the field name.

params.name: nameconflict
params.description:
Action to take if filename is the same as that of a file
 in the directory.

params.name: accept
params.description:
Limits the MIME types to accept. Comma-delimited list. For
 example, to permit JPG and Microsoft Word file uploads:

 accept = "image/jpg, application/msword"

params.name: result
params.description:
Allows you to specify a name for the variable in which cffile
 returns the result (or status) parameters. If you do not specify
 a value for this attribute, cffile uses the prefix "cffile".

params.name: fixnewline
params.description:
* Yes: changes embedded line-ending characters in string
 variables to operating-system specific line endings
 * No: (default) do not change embedded line-ending
 characters in string variables.

params.name: cachedwithin
params.description:
Lucee5+ Timespan, using the CreateTimeSpan function. If original
 file date falls within the time span, cached file data is
 used. CreateTimeSpan defines a period from the present, back.

links.title: Tips for Secure File Uploads with CFML
links.description: Blog entry by Pete Freitag outlining some tips to improve security when dealing with file uploads in CFML.

examples.title: Script Syntax - Write
examples.code: fileWrite(expandPath("./myFile.txt"), "Here's some content for my file.");

examples.title: Script Syntax - Append
examples.description: File Append - There is no fileAppend() so we access the file and use fileWriteLine()

examples.title: Script Syntax - Rename
examples.description: File Rename - Since there is no fileRename(), fileMove() works just as well

examples.title: Tag Syntax (action=write)
examples.description: Write the contents of a variable to a file.
examples.code: <cffile action="write" file="#expandPath("./myFile.txt")#" output="Here's some content for my file.">

examples.title: Tag Syntax (action=append)
examples.description: Append content to the end of a file.
examples.code: <cffile action="append" file="#expandPath("./myFile.txt")#" attributes="normal" output="Here's some new content.">

examples.title: Tag Syntax (action=read)
examples.description: Read a file into a variable

examples.title: Tag Syntax (action=upload)
examples.description: Upload the file contained in the myFile field. Always upload to a directory outside of the webroot, validate the file extension, file content and then only if necessary copy it back to the web root.

examples.title: Tag Syntax (action=upload) with accept
examples.description: CF10+ Checks file extensions against a whitelist of allowed file extensions. You must set `strict=false` when specifying a file extension list.
examples.code: <cffile action="upload" accept=".png,.jpg" strict="false" destination="#getTempDirectory()#" filefield="form.myFile" nameconflict="makeunique">

examples.title: Tag Syntax (action=uploadall)
examples.description: Upload all files in the form scope.
